"Hmmm...<br>This signal...":
"As a theoretical value,
it'd be around... this much?"

"...Oh my.
Where did you come from?"

"You startled me again.
You're very good at hiding your presence."
"What are you up to?"
"Taking an interest in those devices?"

"I've been studying these
Photon Tuners recently."

"With permission from the
people of Retem, of course."

"I've been taking data
on these Photon Tuners."

"I did make sure to ask Mura
in advance, so don't worry."

"However, what I'm really interested in
is not the Tuners themselves..."

"But rather that which they are used to broadcast:
Nadereh's \"Power of Song\"."

"Her power is closely related to
both her inner and outer Photons."

"Which means that, in theory, it is
something similar to a Technique."

"However, a Technique that affects the whole desert should
require an equally enormous amount of Photons."

"Even the strongest Force or Techter would have extreme
difficulty casting such a Technique by themselves."

"So I thought to start by
investigating these devices..."

"Sadly, however, I've
reached a dead end."

"From what I've gathered thus far, the Tuner amplification
isn't strong enough to explain her power."

"Which leads me to believe that most of the power
comes entirely from Nadereh herself."

"If this is the case, then rather than as a Technique,
it could be forces operating on a more fundamental level..."

"By some chance, this could be \"Magic\"...
or something similar to it."
"Magic?"
"You could try asking Nadereh."

"...No, sorry, ignore that.
I got caught up in speculation."
"I'll have to investigate just a bit more."

"That's... true, but I doubt even she herself
would have a theory as to how it works."

"What we know at the moment is that this \"Power of Song\"
is hereditary, and unique to her family lineage alone."

"Furthermore, this power manifested differently
for her than it did for her predecessors."

"Come to think of it, Nadereh said that when she sings,
she puts her \"hopes\" into the song."

"For example, rather than the \"hope\" to strengthen her people,
what really worked was the \"hope\" that no harm comes to them."

"Unlike her predecessors, her song seems to
affect her enemies instead, by making them weaker."

"No, no, even granting that hypothesis,
I'll need more data."

"Either way, hope isn't something that can
really be broken down into numbers."

"If Nadereh's power isn't something that
can be explained scientifically..."

"It could very well be called
a supernatural force."
